attributes.action: Reverse the Decision to Scrap the Gender Recognition Act Consultation Results
attributes.additional_details:
More than 100,000 responses were received on the consultation, largely in favour of improving lives of trans people. 

The government scrapped these results due to their belief that "the results were skewed by an avalanche of responses generated by trans rights groups." 

It was a consultation on trans rights, and transgender people responded to it. This is not skewing results, this is the voice of the people the Gender Recognition Act effects. Bring back the results. Listen to us!
attributes.background: The government held a consultation regarding the Gender Recognition Act, which aimed to find how the general public thought the UK could help transgendered people. It proceeded to scrap the results. Demand that the results be reconsidered and that the Gender Recognition Act be accelerated.

rejection.details:
Reform the Gender Recognition Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327108

Uphold current legal protections for transgender individuals and under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318175

Do not ban gender transition treatments for under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318025

Add gender identity to the characteristics protected under the Equality Act 2010:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301138

Require schools and colleges to have gender neutral toilets:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302997

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934

Allow for a gender neutral option on a passport, such as an "X":
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301083
